bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The City of Winchester, in Frederick County, was first known as Opequon, then as Frederick's Town (or Fredericktown), and, finally, upon establishment as a town in 1752, as Winchester. According to tradition, one of the town's founders, James Wood, named the town in honor of his birthplace in England. Winchester was incorporated as a town in 1779 and as a city in 1874. It was enlarged by annexation from Frederick County in 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: City of Winchester (Va.) Will Books 1794-1938 (bulk 1824-1939), typically records the names of the testatior, list of heirs and the year the wills were proven in court, and probate records such as inventories and appraisments.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional City of Winchester Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.
